abstract:
When you're suffering with an inadequate toolset, especially if you've
just come back from a conference, you may feel like "Now is the time for
change!". However, your first step should be analysis. Before you can
decide this is the right moment for a new tool, let alone choose a tool,
you need to assess your organization's needs and current status. Your
decision should be defined by a triangle of factors: bigger picture
strategic goals, operational reality, related processes, and existing
systems. But when it isn't the right time, it is still possible to make
progress with continued assessment and incremental change...
title: Choosing a tool... and choosing your moment
